title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:01  has joined #xwiki 00:03 <+jvelociter> hey there 00:03 <+jvelociter> sdumitriu: any opinions re my mail about the PR meta data ? 00:09 <@sdumitriu> Let me read it 00:14 <@sdumitriu> Answered 00:15 <+jvelociter> thanks 00:16  has quit 00:41  has quit 00:56  has quit 02:09  has quit 02:17  has joined #xwiki 03:42  has quit 03:49  has quit 05:30  has joined #xwiki 05:33  has quit 05:33  has joined #xwiki 07:19  has joined #xwiki 07:43  has joined #xwiki 07:57  has joined #xwiki 07:59  has quit 08:00  has joined #xwiki 08:00  has left #xwiki 08:17  has quit 08:23  has joined #xwiki 08:42  has joined #xwiki 08:42  has joined #xwiki 08:52  has quit 08:54  good morning team 08:55  seems that sergiu's been busy over the week end :) 09:02  has joined #xwiki 09:12  has joined #xwiki 09:13  has joined #xwiki 09:13  good morning 09:18  has joined #xwiki 09:31 <+rstavro> sorry, that's it for Extension.Space ColorTheme :) 09:31  nice 09:36 <+sburjan> FYI : I will redo the screenshots fom Color Theme app because new UI change 09:37 <+rstavro> thx :) 10:17 <+sburjan> Color Theme app page updated 11:04  has quit 11:06  has joined #xwiki 11:06  has quit 11:07 <+sburjan> vmassol: May I add a Test Reports link on the General Links Panel from xwiki.org ? 11:08  sburjan: I don't think so 11:08  it should be only visible from dev subwiki and from the Test page it's enough IMO (+ from the release notes) 11:09 <+sburjan> okay 11:09  otherwise it would crowd even more the main flow 11:09 <+sburjan> I will update dev xwiki before M2 11:09 <+sburjan> yepp, I understand 11:16  has quit 11:20  has joined #xwiki 11:25  has joined #xwiki 11:29  he 11:29  hey 11:29  are there any plans to release a 2.7.1 at some point? 11:30  yes 11:30  i created a couple of tickets and it'd be nice to have a version that fixes those before i leave here and i am really unsure if i should upgrade to 3.0 because i doubt it'll be finished before i leave 11:31  but if you say yes it's all nice and sunny :) 11:31  has quit 11:32  I don't know when though, but I'd say in not too long…. if I had to take a guess I'd say within a month 11:32  which is just fine 11:34  about http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax#HLinks << there are no plans for major changes on that page within the next few days, are there? 11:35  because i'd like to translate it without having to redo completely it in a weeks time 11:35  has quit 11:35  well we want to change that page completely at some point, we even started some work but we've been delayed. I'd like that work to continue so that we can introduce the new XWiki Syntax 2.1 11:36  actually we don't want to change it completely in term of content 11:36  fair enough. are there any plans on what it will look like? 11:36  more in term of L&F 11:36  L&F? 11:36  look and feel 11:36  right 11:36  there were a few suggestions 11:36  well, i could probably work on it 11:36  but you'd have to tell me what you expect 11:36  ah that would be great 11:36  let me fish the link 11:36  cool 11:37  http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/ojrswk4kdoosekqa 11:37  you could reply to that thread 11:37  also, in the current wiki on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax#HLinks (note the section) we see one of them nasty little smileys ;) 11:38 <+sburjan> jstoldt: what do you mean "leave here" ? 11:38  sould prolly be better to use [ ] instead of ( ) there anyway... to me ( ) suggests content and not placeholder 11:38  sburjan: i'm only an internee and i'll finish my internship at the end of february 11:39  so from that point on i will no longer be able to maintain the wiki instance i built in this department 11:39 <+sburjan> well yes, but you can still join this chan and use XWiki :) 11:39  that i can do if i find enough time between my various other activities ;) 11:41  need to power down right now 11:41  be back in half an hour or so 11:42  has quit 11:56  has joined #xwiki 12:01  has joined #xwiki 12:18  has joined #xwiki 12:18  re 12:40  has quit 12:44  has joined #xwiki 12:48  has joined #xwiki 12:49  has quit 12:49  has joined #xwiki 12:54  vmassol: regarding the syntax page, i read through the thread and i checked out the two proposals 12:55  this is all nice and good but what i wonder about is, since there is no decision on which way to go, how should i proceed if i were to rework the entire syntax page in one rather swift action? 13:02  jstoldt: you could resurrect the thread by replying, stating what you prefer and what action you'd like to do 13:02  ok, i shall do that 13:03  IMO the newest proposal is the best. IMO we could also use the new vertical menu that sergiu is introducing for the admin/profile UI 13:03  i agree, i prefere it, too 13:04  about additional menus and whatnot, i'm really only conerned about the content and its layout, if that's okay 13:04  http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Improvements/Administration#HVerticalTabs 13:04  don't want to interfere with code decissions too much unless bugs are concerned ;) 13:05  menu looks nice but, IMO, it does not work too well with the colibri skin with that style 13:05  I think a global syntax chooser was also discussed, which I think I'd like too 13:05  most certainly! 13:06  in term of implementation I'd see it as 3 pages 13:06  one per syntax 13:06  1.0, 2.0, 2.1 13:07  actually one page per syntax category would be ok too 13:08  has quit 13:09  has joined #xwiki 13:16  has joined #xwiki 13:16  am i understanding you correctly, you propose to split the different syntaxes among different documents? 13:17  because i think it would be benefitial to use one document, like in the mockup right now 13:17  evalica: hi. I've noticed something. Using ##{{{something}}}## in syntax 2.0 doesn't display in monospace. I think it's our CSS rules. Do you think you could look into that? 13:18  in fact, what i would really like would be something that would basically be using the current syntax when writing and then displays optionally 13:18  jstoldt: personally I like this: http://confluence.atlassian.com/renderer/notationhelp.action?section=all 13:18  ie the ability to see them all in a page + the ability to see only a specific syntax topic 13:19  yeah, that's nice for getting an overview 13:19  but i was talking about the different syntaxes just now 13:19  ah yes several documents is better because one is just unmaintainable, too large 13:20  + not all syntaxes may be avail in a given wiki 13:20  like using divs to show and hide particular columns and/or subsections 13:20  read about div here: http://www.codeguru.com/forum/showthread.php?threadid=504504 13:20  ;) 13:21  has joined #xwiki 13:21  what bugs me most about having one document for each syntax is that inevitably their layout and/or wording will differ 13:21  unless somebody really takes his time when modifying the page 13:22  i'd really like to have something like the current syntax page, only with some good filtering 13:22 <+evalica> vmassol: the tt monospace- yes the style is causing it - the problem is that is custom added so the code fixed something - I'll try to look at it 13:23  WDYT? 13:23  evalica: ok thanks. I'll create a jira issue now 13:25 <+evalica> vmassol: what do you think about the rendering? is it ok?

something

? there are two tags nested 13:26  evalica: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XSCOLIBRI-265 13:26  evalica: would you suggest something else? ## generates and {{{ generates 13:26 <+evalica> vmassol: because the tt has the monospace style .. but the tt.wikimodel-verbatim overrides the font-family 13:27 <+evalica> I mean why are there 2 tt ? one simple and one with a class.. for something simple like that ? 13:27  maybe 
 (if it's valid in xhtml)  
13:27  becuase as I said  
13:27  one is for monospace  
13:27  and one for verbatim  
13:27  we need to map this to html  
13:28  and it was chosen to use  and  now we could modify that if we agree  
13:29 <@sdumitriu> 
 is not allowed inline  
13:29 <@sdumitriu> It's a block element  
13:29  note that  all this was discussed on the list  
13:29  I don't remember all the details though  
13:30  ok sdumitriu that's a good point  
13:38  evalica: I don't see why tt.wikimodel-verbatim would need to override the font-family  
13:38  do you see a need?  
13:38  verbatim shouldn't care with style  
13:39 <+evalica> it was added with the CSS Cleanup ... I know there is a place where is was usefull  
13:39 <+evalica> can't remember when  
13:39 <+evalica> actually I never used verbatim so I don't actually know how it suppose to work  
13:40  verbatim is just … verbatim  
13:40 <+evalica> :)  
13:40  the tt class="…" is just there as a marker  
13:40  so that our XHTML parser can retransform it into verbatim wiki syntax  
13:41 <+evalica> somthing like "noformat"?  
13:41  it's to prevent wiki syntax inside verbatim to be taken tinto account  
13:41  yes  
13:41 <+evalica> noformat would have been a better wording IMO :P  
13:41  verbatim is the official word I think  
13:42 <@sdumitriu> evalica: How about tt .wikimodel-verbatim {font-family:...}  
13:42  noformat is not correct  
13:43 <@sdumitriu> (space between tt and dot  
13:43  it's not about formatting  
13:43  norender would have been more exact but verbatim is really best IMO ;)  
13:43 <+evalica> right now we have:  
13:43 <+evalica> tt.wikimodel-verbatim {    font-family: sans-serif;    white-space: pre;}  
13:43 <+evalica> tt {    font-family: monospace;}  
13:43  anyway  
13:43 <@sdumitriu> evalica: Yes, and add the descendant rule  
13:44 <+evalica> sdumitriu: I don't know how it renders usually so I can say what selector is suitable  
13:45 <+evalica> well if you put it with a space it will still not be monospaced  
13:47 <@sdumitriu> Why?  
13:47 <@sdumitriu> Let me try  
13:48 <+evalica> you would need a tt tt .wikimodel-verbatim  and should be put down the cascade  
13:48 <@sdumitriu> It works locally  
13:48  note: I'm the one who introduced the font in rev 12963 but that was wrong  
13:48 <+evalica> sdumitriu: for me is not working locally :P  
13:49 <+evalica> 
something
 this should be monospaced? right? and with space or not is not monospace  
13:49 <@sdumitriu> Don't replace the existing tt.w-v rule  
13:50 <@sdumitriu> Add one with a space after it  
13:51 <+evalica> yes If you add yes ... I modified them  
13:51 <+evalica> the tt declaration should be also moved? in order to stay together? or should be keep the separation between HTML and specific classes?  
13:52 <+evalica> I mean having tt, tt .wikimodel-verbatim {  font-family: monospace;} after the one with a .  
13:52 <@sdumitriu> I think tt should be left alone  
13:53 <@sdumitriu> Let me check where it is now  
13:53 <+evalica> upper in the html components  
13:53  has quit  
13:53 <@sdumitriu> Yes, should be left alone, since it's basic element styling  
13:54 <+evalica> k sdumitriu you should commit is since you provided the solution  
13:54 <@sdumitriu> K  
13:55 <+evalica> sdumitriu: I want to test everything you commited in the weekend.. but wanted to ask .. the css for xformInline is not commited, right? because I didn't commited it - cause I've seen you use it on XWiki.ResetPasswd.. etc  
13:56 <@sdumitriu> Probably not  
13:56 <+evalica> k

14:02 <+sburjan> bbl

14:49  small question, i configured some pages in a way that only one or two members have edit access. now i want to grant editing rights to another user but i want to do it for the entire wiki, thus overriding all per space and per page settings  
14:50  so i granted the user edit rights in the wiki settings but apparently he cannot edit the pages where i assigned the edit rights to one or two users  
14:50  any suggestions?  
14:58  sdumitriu: thanks for the verbatim thing commit but it's not working here, see http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XSCOLIBRI-265?focusedCommentId=57381&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action\_57381

15:13  and i ensured the commit from sergiu was in my colibri.css file  
15:13 <+evalica> the happy face gets transformed in :)  
15:13 <+evalica> : )  
15:13  that's not the problem  
15:13  the problem is that monospace isn't there  
15:14 <+evalica> I have it  
15:14  I tried both in FF and in chrome

15:25 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: since when we have the AJAX feature to add subcategories in blog ?  
15:25  it's the comment I think  
15:26  colibri.css is rendered as:  
15:26  http://pastebin.com/8BHMnE2p  
15:26  when I look at it in chrome dev tool  
15:26  so it's commented out  
15:27 <+evalica> it's because the css is velocity parsed? and ## is a velocity comment  
15:27  yes  
15:27  my guess is that sergiu added the comment while committing  
15:28  :)  
15:28  fixing  
15:29  has quit  
15:29 <+evalica> sergiu was just trying to give the example ##{{{something}}}##  
15:30  I know what sergiu was doing  
15:30  :)  
15:30 <+evalica> :)  
15:30  at some point I thought I was the one going mad  
15:30 <+evalica> in my manual css I didn't added the comment :P I know what the code it was doing  
15:31 <+evalica> I though :) you forgot once again to clear your cache :P  
15:31 <+evalica> it was funny if that was the case  
15:32  ok it's working now  
15:32 <+evalica> k  
15:36 <+jvelociter> sdumitriu: Hi  
15:36 <+jvelociter> I'm reading your comment about XWIKI-5848  
15:36 <+jvelociter> I don't understand it  
15:43  yehaa, found anther bug  
15:44  displaying annotations fucks up non-ascii chars in the page...  
15:44  is that a known error or should i make a ticket?  
15:44  no idea. lucaa? otherwise you can always create to be on the safe side  
15:45  sure  
15:45  adding  
15:45  it seems to be related to another ticket i opneed a while ago  
15:46  XWIKI-5879  
15:46 <+lucaa> vmassol: about what? can you resume the conversation in a sentence?  
15:46  lucaa: about:  
15:46 <+lucaa> vmassol: foudn  
15:46 <+lucaa> sorru  
15:46  "displaying annotations fucks up non-ascii chars in the page..."  
15:46 <+lucaa> sorry for the noise  
15:46 <+lucaa> jstoldt: create issue  
15:46  np  
15:46  pretty much the same error, only a different place  
15:53  jstoldt: smiley creepage fixed on the syntax page  
15:53  nice one :)  
15:53  especially the paraphrasing of "there's a bug on the syntax page"... very nice, indeed  
15:54  what i noticed earlier, when you put (n) on a header it will cause a thumbs down icon to appear... is it really desirable to display icons on headings?  
15:55  has joined #xwiki  
15:55  headings contain wiki syntax  
15:55  making exceptions is usually a bad idea  
15:56  i think the (n) will prolly cause some trouble for german customers unless they use the WYSIWYG editor because (n) is something you kinda do in German... like "page(s)" in English is "Seite(n)" in German... that applies to quite a lot of words at one point or another  
15:56  okay, if that's the oppinion it's fine. just wanted to mention it in case it's not actually desired  
16:16  right, new issue regarding the above mentioned error: XWIKI-5913

18:38 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I have a problem. XWIKI-5897 is caused because URL factory encodes '-' to protect the URL in xwiki 1.0 syntax.  Office Viewer uses URLEncoder.encode when creating the temporary file and Document.getURL to generate the temp resource action URL. URLEncoder doesn't encode '-' but Document.getURL does it. So temp resource action doesn't find the file. I guess we can't drop the '-' encoding in URLFactory so I have to either encode '-' in  
18:42  has quit  
18:50 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: I'd say drop the encoding in getURL  
18:50 <+mflorea> might break some xwiki 1.0 syntax documents  
18:50 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
18:50 <@sdumitriu> The problem in syntax 1.0 is not that serious  
18:50 <@sdumitriu> Not many documents have -- in their name  
18:51 <+mflorea> yes, but afaik we are still supporting it  
18:54 <+mflorea> I think I'll modify TempResourceAction to do:  
18:54 <+mflorea> URLEncoder.encode(URLDecoder.decode(page, "UTF-8"))  
18:54 <+mflorea> so that only the minimal encoding is done, untill we drop support for xwiki 1.0 syntax

22:30 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: Ping  
22:31 <+jvelociter> pong  
22:31 <+jvelociter> Hi  
22:32 <@sdumitriu> About XWIKI-5848  
22:32 <@sdumitriu> I mean that as far as I've read on the net about the IE8-XSS filter, it only applies when a request is done across domains  
22:33 <@sdumitriu> So same domain requests should never be influenced by that particular filter  
22:34 <+jvelociter> you mean that if the request is made against the same domain the response has been served it's not triggered ?  
22:34  has quit  
22:35 <+jvelociter> here is what I observed :  
22:35 <+jvelociter> - I could reproduce the bug  
22:35 <+jvelociter> - I disabled XSS filter in options, the bug stop showing  
22:35 <+jvelociter> - I reenabled XSS filter, the bug did not come back :(  
22:35 <+jvelociter> Now I can't reproduce again  
22:35 <+jvelociter> but Charles could on his IE8  
22:35 <+jvelociter> and XSS filter was indeed not active on the local intranet zone for him  
22:35 <+jvelociter> I'm a bit puzzled by this bug now :)
